entities.description: National Survey on Drug Use and Health, providing data on the use of tobacco, alcohol, drugs, substance use disorders, mental health issues, and treatment among the civilian population aged 12 or older in the U.S.
Use of a drug as specified in the survey, including prescription and non-prescription substances.
Misuse of prescription drugs, referred to as 'nonmedical' use.
Receipt of inpatient or outpatient treatment for substance use or mental health issues.
Drugs prescribed for medical use, including pain relievers, tranquilizers, stimulants, or sedatives.
Non-prescription drugs, including cocaine, heroin, and methamphetamine.
Substances causing hallucinations, specified with certain codes in NSDUH.
Substances inhaled for mind-altering effects, specified with certain codes in NSDUH.

relationships.description: Relates the respondent to their reported use of drugs as specified in the survey.
Indicates that the respondent received treatment for substance use or mental health issues in the past 12 months.
Indicates reported misuse of prescription drugs by the respondent.
Indicates use of prescription drugs by the respondent for medical or nonmedical purposes.
Indicates use of illicit drugs by the respondent.
Indicates use of hallucinogens by the respondent.
Indicates use of inhalants by the respondent.
